intro: Diplectria assamica, commonly known as the Assam thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of India. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its branched stems, palmately lobed leaves, and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed capsule that contains several seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded areas and is adapted to the cool, temperate climate of its native habitat.
